title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE (AP) — It wasn't a game played on a hardwood floor so much as it was a personal canvas for Shaquille O’Neal. In a breathtaking, historic performance, the Los Angeles Lakers' colossal center delivered a masterpiece, pouring in a staggering 49 points to power the Lakers to a 109-100 road victory over the Charlotte Hornets.

From the opening tip, this was the Shaq Show. The Hornets had no answer for the league's most dominant force, who was a whirlwind of power and precision in the paint. Every drop-step was a thunderclap, every dunk an exclamation point. He wasn't just scoring; he was imposing his will, turning the game into a one-man demolition derby against which Charlotte had no defensive recourse.

While O'Neal was the unstoppable storm, his teammates expertly fed the tempest. Nick Van Exel orchestrated the offense with 13 assists, ensuring the big man was consistently fed in his spots of dominance.

The Hornets, valiant but simply overmatched by the singular force they faced, were led by Glen Rice's 22 points. But even an All-Star's output pales next to a legend having his night. Every Charlotte run was answered by another powerful O’Neal move, another effortless hook shot, another authoritative finish that sucked the hope from the home crowd.

When the final buzzer sounded, the 49-point tally was more than just a number. It was a declaration, a performance for the ages that underscored O’Neal’s sheer dominance. On this night, the Lakers didn't just win a basketball game; they rode a historic tsunami of power, authored entirely by the man in the middle.
